(2) If after the termination of the present war any person is guilty of an offence under the Defence of the Realm Regulations continued hy this Act which, by any such regula- 25 tion, is declared to he an offence against those regulations, he shall- (a) on conviction on indictment be liable to imprisonment with or without hard labour for a term not exceeding two years; or 30 (b) on conviction under the Summary Jurisdiction Acts be liable to imprisonment with or without hard labour for a term not exceeding six months or to a fine not exceeding one hundred pounds, or to both such imprisonment and fine; 35 and if guilty of an offence which under any such regulation is declared to be a summary offence he shall be liable on con- viction under the Summary Jurisdiction Acts to imprisonment with or without hard labour for a term not exceeding six months or to a fine not exceeding one hundred pounds or to 40 both such imprisonment and fine, and the court may in any case, whether or not the offence is a summary offence, order A.
